newsitem.title: MEXICO: GF Bancomer Q2 profit rises vs Q1.
newsitem.headline: GF Bancomer Q2 profit rises vs Q1.

text.p: Mexican financial banking group Bancomer said on Thursday its second quarter net profit was 479 million pesos, 33 percent higher than its first quarter result.
The net capitalisation ratio of the group's banking unit Bancomer was 14.51 percent against a first quarter ratio of 14.36 percent, it added.

Profits for the banking unit, the group's major subsidiary, rose 28 percent compared with the first quarter of this year, reaching 404 million pesos in the second quarter. Its cumulative profit for 1997 was 709 million pesos.
Reserves against past due loans for the Bancomer banking unit were steady at 57.5 percent -- well above the regulatory minimum of 45 percent, GF Bancomer said in a statement.
The group's brokerage subsidiary Casa de Bolsa Bancomer saw its net profits dip slightly to 30 million pesos in the second quarter versus 31 million in the first quarter.
They totalled 61 million pesos over the first six months of the year. ((--Caroline Brothers, Mexico City newsroom +525 728 7902))
